{"step_by_step_thinking": "Leuprorelin acetate is a luteinising hormone-releasing hormone analogue. It has been used in the palliative treatment of prostate cancer for more than 20 years. It is administered in the form of a depot injection and is effective in suppressing testosterone secretion. This is a form of androgen deprivation therapy, which is a standard treatment for patients with advanced prostate cancer. Therefore, leuprorelin acetate can be used as androgen deprivation therapy.", "answer_choice": "A"}
